page.title: 14RIDGE CLOSE FARM,DOVE HOLES.
page.content: The farm is owned by Derek Shaw & is dairy farm of l30 acres,half of which are used for grazing & half for hay & silage. He rents some land from ICI. The land is marshy,rocky & uneven & at one time was used for lead-mining. Because of this the land is liable to subsidence. The farm is crossed by the cutting of the Peak Forest Tramway. The daily milk yield of 800 litres from 57 cows goes to the dairy at Hyde.The machinery for grass-cutting is expensive to buy & Mr.Shaw finds it difficult to make a profit & believes that future farming will suffer from over-production. He feels that the public should be able to buy extra food cheaper.He is a cornet player with Dove Holes Band but does not have a lot of leisure time.
